newsitem.title: FRANCE: France to pay Eurocopter as soon as possible.
newsitem.headline: France to pay Eurocopter as soon as possible.

text.p: The French government hopes to pay 700 million francs owed to Eurocopter, the Franco-German helicopter maker, as soon as possible for its work on the NH90 military aircraft, a defence ministry official said on Thursday.
France owes the money as its share of the development costs for the NH90 following a decision last year to delay deliveries of the army version of the helicopter to 2010 or 2011, from 2001/2002.
Defence budget freezes last year led to the payment delays to Eurocopter, which is 70 percent held by Aerospatiale and 30 percent by Daimler-Benz Aerospace.

A spokesman for the DGA arms procurement office said the delays were aggravated by the complex legal structure of the NH90 programme, which is handled under a NATO contract and involves four countries -- France, Germany, Italy and The Netherlands.
NH Industries is the prime contractor for the project, with Eurocopter, Italy's Agusta SpA and Fokker Aviation, a Stork NV unit, as industrial partners.
Eurocopter chairman Jean-Francois Bigay said on Wednesday the group had cut its debt last year by more than one billion francs to 1.5 billion, despite the late payment by the government.
